titles.title: Kindaichi Shounen no Jikenbo Returns
Kindaichi Case Files R
Kindaichi R
金田一少年の事件簿R[リターンズ]
The Case File of Young Kindaichi Returns
The File of Young Kindaichi Returns
金田一少年事件簿R
Los casos de Kindaichi regresan

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch45815 [Kindaichi Hajime], the supposed grandson of the famous private detective Kindaichi Kosuke. One day, Hajime and his girlfriend http://anidb.net/ch45816 [Miyuki] visit Hong Kong for a fashion event, where Miyuki is mistaken for someone else and kidnapped. Trying to save Miyuki will lead to an altogether different criminal case... Source: ytv

externalentity.identifier: 金田一少年の事件簿_(アニメ)

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: China
tag.description: China, officially the People`s Republic of China (PRC), is a unitary sovereign state in East Asia and the world`s most populous country. It is the third- or fourth-largest country by total area, depending on the source consulted. China also has the most neighbor countries in the world. Governed by the Communist Party of China, it exercises jurisdiction over 22 provinces, five autonomous regions, four direct-controlled municipalities (Beijing, Tianjin, Shanghai, and Chongqing), and the special administrative regions of Hong Kong and Macau. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: law and order
tag.description: Where there is "wealth", there are criminals. It is up to the civil law enforcement, i.e. detectives, Police or Special Squads, to keep the lawless activities in the real world or in cyberspace under control. Note: Do not confuse this with Military presence.

tag.name: adapted into JDrama
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a JDrama. A JDrama (Japanese drama), also called "terebi dorama" ("television drama") or "dorama" for short, is a Japanese live action television series. Japan produces many drama series every year, from a huge variety of genres. Like anime, they generally air in three-month seasons or multiples thereof, with new shows airing every season. Some kinds of drama, especially the morning or afternoon ones, tend to be broadcast daily, while evening ones tend to be broadcast weekly, also like anime. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: Hong Kong
tag.description: Hong Kong, officially the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People`s Republic of China, is an autonomous territory on the eastern side of the Pearl River estuary in East Asia, south of the mainland Chinese province of Guangdong, and east of the special administrative region of Macau. Hong Kong is the fourth-most densely populated region in the world. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Liu Ivy
character.description: A fashion designer at the Tokyo Girly Mode in Hong Kong event.

episode.title: 香港九龍財宝殺人事件 File.1
The Hong Kong Kowloon Treasure Murder Case, File 1
L`affaire des meurtres du trésor de Kowloon à Hong Kong - Dossier 1
Hong Kong Kowloon Zaihou Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: When a model who looks like Miyuki goes missing, Miyuki is recruited to take her place at a fashion show event in Hong Kong. Hajime and Miyuki go to Hong Kong, where they run into their friend, Saki... and Miyuki is abducted! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 香港九龍財宝殺人事件 File.2
The Hong Kong Kowloon Treasure Murder Case, File 2
L`affaire des meurtres du trésor de Kowloon à Hong Kong - Dossier 2
Hong Kong Kowloon Zaihou Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: While surprising information about the parentage of several of the people involved is revealed, Ran is kidnapped for real and the true nature of the Poison Dragon comes to light. Ran`s tattoo indicates the whereabouts of a nuclear bomb that could detonate in less than 12 hours! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 香港九龍財宝殺人事件 File.4
The Hong Kong Kowloon Treasure Murder Case, File 4
L`affaire des meurtres du trésor de Kowloon à Hong Kong - Dossier 4
Hong Kong Kowloon Zaihou Satsujin Jiken File. 4
episode.summary: Kindaichi unmasks the true Poison Dragon! Did Miyuki really murder three people in Hong Kong? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 香港九龍財宝殺人事件 File.3
The Hong Kong Kowloon Treasure Murder Case, File 3
L`affaire des meurtres du trésor de Kowloon à Hong Kong - Dossier 3
Hong Kong Kowloon Zaihou Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: While Detective Li races to find the bomb before it goes off, Kindaichi goes back to the hotel to recreate the first murder. But how can one killer account for three murders when all of the main suspects have perfect alibis? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 錬金術殺人事件 File.3
The Alchemy Murder Case, File 3
L`affaire des meurtres autour de l`alchimie ! Dossier 3
Renkinjutsu Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: The Alchemist has already committed four murders, but Kindaichi is determined that there be no more. He also wants to prove Reika-chan`s innocence, since her fellow entertainers have seen fit to tie her up in the meantime. Can Kindaichi solve the twin mysteries of the locked room murder and the vanished sword? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 錬金術殺人事件 File.2
The Alchemy Murder Case, File 2
L`affaire des meurtres autour de l`alchimie ! Dossier 2
Renkinjutsu Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: The bodies start piling up in the mansion on a solitary island. And when one member is murdered inside of a locked room, the only possible suspect is Reika-chan?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 錬金術殺人事件 File.1
The Alchemy Murder Case, File 1
L`affaire des meurtres autour de l`alchimie ! Dossier 1
Renkinjutsu Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: Kindaichi is on a treasure-hunting reality show with the goal to find a hidden ton of gold bullion, but he and the other contestants and staff don`t realize they`re being stalked by a murderous masked figure who may be an alchemist! Making matters worse is the fact that they`re trapped on an isolated island with no means of communication! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 速水玲香と招かれざる客
Hayami Reika and the Uninvited Guest
Reika Hayami et l`invité indésirable
Hayami Reika to Manekarezaru Kyaku
episode.summary: Kindaichi is on a party boat with idol Hayami Reika and a lot of her other fans. He would be having a great time, too, if it weren`t for the suspicious man next to him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獄門塾殺人事件 File.3
The Prison Prep School Murder Case, File 3
L`affaire des meurtres à Gokumon ! Dossier 3
Gokumonjuku Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: Chaos ensues when the bodies of four missing students are discovered murdered and positioned in grisly ways patterned after class topics. Kindaichi and Inspector Akechi collaborate by phone from their separate murder sites, but are stumped when everyone has an alibi. Will the Puppeteer from Hell have the last laugh? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獄門塾殺人事件 File.2
The Prison Prep School Murder Case, File 2
L`affaire des meurtres à Gokumon ! Dossier 2
Gokumonjuku Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: The Gokumon Prep School study retreat begins and the conditions are even harsher than Kindaichi was expecting! Not only that, he and Miyuki are put in a separate group, although they both hear hints of a group of six students who did something unforgivable in the past and now fear deadly retribution. Whose strings are the Puppeteer from Hell pulling and what is he going to make them do?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獄門塾殺人事件 File.1
The Prison Prep School Murder Case, File 1
L`affaire des meurtres à Gokumon ! Dossier 1
Gokumonjuku Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: When Hajime is in danger of having to repeat a year, Miyuki takes him to the hellishly strict Gokumon Prep School. But even before they can get a tour, a former student is murdered there via poison. Kindaichi is on the case, but it looks to become much bigger with a study retreat taking place in a secluded area and the machinations of the Puppeteer from Hell! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 錬金術殺人事件 File.4
The Alchemy Murder Case, File 4
L`affaire des meurtres autour de l`alchimie ! Dossier 4
Renkinjutsu Satsujin Jiken File. 4
episode.summary: Hajime uncovers the Alchemist`s final trick, and then exposes the killer`s identity! But what is the person`s motive for brutally murdering four people in a mansion on a remote island? The answer lies within a tale of tragedy and revenge! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending 1
Opening 1
獄門塾殺人事件 File.4
The Prison Prep School Murder Case, File 4
L`affaire des meurtres à Gokumon ! Dossier 4
Gokumonjuku Satsujin Jiken File. 4
episode.summary: Kindaichi discovers the secret that punctures everyone`s supposedly airtight alibi! He assembles both groups, explains the reasoning behind the theme murders, and calls out the identity of Sparrow, the serial murderer of six students! Except as it turns out, Sparrow is actually... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 高度一万メートルの殺人 File.2
Murder at 10,000 Meters, File 2
Meurtre à 10 000 mètres d`altitude Dossier 2
Koudo Ichiman Meter no Satsujin File. 2
episode.summary: Hajime and Akechi team up to expose Captain Shida`s killer... or is that killers?! Whatever the case, it leads to a situation where the plane itself (including the hundreds of passengers inside) is put in a perilous position and only one person has a shot of saving them all... but it`s not Hajime! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 高度一万メートルの殺人 File.1
Murder at 10,000 Meters, File 1
Meurtre à 10 000 mètres d`altitude Dossier 1
Koudo Ichiman Meter no Satsujin File. 1
episode.summary: Hajime, Miyuki, Inspector Kenmochi, and Superintendent Akechi are on JAM flight 377, despite the terrorist threat received right before takeoff. They`re getting closer to home when smoke suddenly fills the plane from the rear and the passengers panic, thinking it`s terrorism. But things aren`t what they appear as Hajime and Akechi soon find themselves trying to solve a locked-room murder case 10,000 meters in the air! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 獄門塾殺人事件 File.5
The Prison Prep School Murder Case, File 5
L`affaire des meurtres à Gokumon ! Dossier 5
Gokumonjuku Satsujin Jiken File. 5
episode.summary: Kindaichi reveals the identity of the second murdering Sparrow! But how did the Puppeteer from Hell convince two law-abiding people to commit serial murder? And what fate lies in store for all three criminals? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣持警部の殺人 File.2
Inspector Kenmochi, Murderer, File 2
Le meurtre de l`inspecteur Kenmochi - Dossier 2
Kenmochi Keibu no Satsujin File. 2
episode.summary: More evidence backs the unpopular idea that the missing Inspector Kenmochi is targeting the former minors out of revenge for what they did to the teenaged Marina three years ago. Although Hajime is convinced his old friend would never resort to vigilantism, Superintendent Akechi puts out an APB on Kenmochi on suspicion of murder! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣持警部の殺人 File.1
Inspector Kenmochi, Murderer, File 1
Le meurtre de l`inspecteur Kenmochi - Dossier 1
Kenmochi Keibu no Satsujin File. 1
episode.summary: Three years ago, a girl died after being kidnapped and abused. The three minors who were responsible are back on the street, but when one of them is shot, Inspector Kenmochi disappears. Has old man Kenmochi turned vigilante?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 飛込プールの悪霊
Evil Spirit of the Diving Pool
L`esprit maléfique du bassin de plongeoir
Tobikomi Pool no Akurei
episode.summary: In the summer of their third year in middle school, Miyuki drags Hajime to swimming school so he can finally learn, but they stumble upon drama between two divers and former best friends competing for a place at a prestigious high school. An accident happens, putting the wealthy, privileged diver into a coma. Was it down to the rumored "evil spirit of the diving pool"? Hajime suspects a more down-to-earth evil and investigates! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キャンプ場の"怪"事件
The Campground "Ghost" Case
La "mystérieuse" affaire du camping
Camp-jou no "Kai" Jiken
episode.summary: One of Kindaichi`s earliest cases is a delicate situation as the 14-year-old Hajime is on the trail of Miyuki`s missing panties (and watch) from a campground. Complicating matters is the fact that Hajime himself is one of only three suspects, all of whom seem to have an ironclad alibi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲームの館殺人事件 File.2
The Game Mansion Murder Case, File 2
L`affaire des meurtres dans la demeure du jeu - Dossier 2
Game no Kan Satsujin Jiken File. 2
episode.summary: The Game Master`s deadly game continues, pitting Hajime and company against one lethal trap after another. In fact, it seems like the murderous mastermind wants to do away with all of the members. Will Hajime make it out of the Game Mansion alive, let alone unmask the Game Master? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲームの館殺人事件 File.1
The Game Mansion Murder Case, File 1
L`affaire des meurtres dans la demeure du jeu - Dossier 1
Game no Kan Satsujin Jiken File. 1
episode.summary: On the bus ride home from an amusement park, Hajime and Miyuki are knocked out with a sleeping gas. They wake up to find themselves trapped in an abandoned hospital with the other bus passengers. Their only chance of getting out alive is by solving the mysterious Game Master`s puzzles! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣持警部の殺人 File.4
Inspector Kenmochi, Murderer, File 4
Le meurtre de l`inspecteur Kenmochi - Dossier 4
Kenmochi Keibu no Satsujin File. 4
episode.summary: Kindaichi reveals the identity of the real Executioner at last! But what prompted his acts of bloody vengeance? Plus, a guest appearance by Hajime`s nemesis! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 剣持警部の殺人 File.3
Inspector Kenmochi, Murderer, File 3
Le meurtre de l`inspecteur Kenmochi - Dossier 3
Kenmochi Keibu no Satsujin File. 3
episode.summary: The Executioner strikes again, this time kidnapping Busujima! Can Hajime and Akechi track them down before it`s too late? Plus, more evidence points to Inspector Kenmochi being the murderous vigilante! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲームの館殺人事件 File.3
The Game Mansion Murder Case, File 3
L`affaire des meurtres dans la demeure du jeu - Dossier 3
Game no Kan Satsujin Jiken File. 3
episode.summary: Kindaichi unmasks the Game Master, reveals their murderous motive, and shows how their tricks were done. But will the game of death claim one more victim? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Opening 2
Ending 2
